intro: Parrya siliquosa, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at high elevations. Its leaves are compound, with multiple leaflets arranged in a distinctive pattern. Parrya siliquosa produces small, elongated seed pods that mature in the fall, dispersing seeds through wind.
